subject: Sexual Health
title: Growth Spurts
description: A quick win: understand Growth Spurts.

hook.text: During puberty, teens can grow 3 to 4 inches per year. Bones literally lengthen while they sleep.

buildup.text: Growth hormone and sex hormones work together to stimulate the growth plates at the ends of long bones.

discovery.text: Girls typically have their growth spurt earlier, around age 11. Boys peak around age 13.

twist.text: The same sex hormones that fuel growth eventually close the growth plates, permanently ending height increase.

climax.text: Nutrition, sleep, and overall health during puberty directly influence how much height potential is reached.

punchline.text: Grow fast, then stop. Puberty builds your final frame.

quiz.question: What eventually stops height growth during puberty?
